\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 99451}

\subsection*{Some General Notes}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{DM}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 150 mg & oral & 6-APB & powder / crystals\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 0.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
I find 6-APB to be very similar to MDMA and my preferred method of ingestion is orally. Considering the similarities in molecule structures to MDMA and the receptors it affects, one should not discount the possibility of cardiotoxicity and neurotoxicity which is debatably present with MDMA.



I find a good dose of 6-APB to be about 100mg-150mg to come up, and another 50mg taken 45 minutes later to extend the plateau.



6-APB's effects were similar, though notably less intense than the positive, neutral, and negative effects listed for \href{http://www.erowid.org/chemicals/mdma/effects}{MDMA}.



In my experience, the come up is more pleasant than coming up on MDMA, however the euphoria and `love' at the peak of 6-APB is not quite as good as MDMA. I also believe the come-down depression that is present with MDMA isn't as intense with 6-APB.



As with MDMA, mixing 6-APB with any MAOI's can present a risk of Serotonin Syndrome; a possibly life threatening disorder with very sudden symptom onset.



I also drink plenty of water.

\end{document}
